events.message: Customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred at the intersection, resulting in significant front-end damage to the car.
The claim was classified under Auto Accident category after reviewing the initial report and accident description.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to manage communications and assist with further claim processing.
Acknowledgement sent to the customer confirming receipt of the auto accident claim and next steps.
Requested police report, photographs of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates to proceed with the investigation.
Customer submitted all requested documents including the police report and mechanicâ€™s damage assessment.
Investigation team commenced examination of submitted documents and contacted witnesses to verify accident details.
Investigation concluded with confirmation that the accident was caused by a third-party vehicle running a red light.
A settlement amount was proposed to cover the repair costs and rental car expenses during the vehicle repair period.
Customer provided positive feedback regarding the smooth handling and timely information throughout the claim process.
The claim was officially approved based on documentation and investigation findings supporting the customer's case.
Insurance payment was processed and issued to the customer to cover all approved damages and costs.
The auto accident claim was formally closed with no outstanding issues or further requirements pending.
